body:
Adoptium only offers x64 for Java 8 and macOS, which means that Gradle's toolchain support cannot automatically download an appropriate JDK 8 for you.

So you have to manually download and install an aarch64 compatible JDK 8 for macOS for the build to work.

I got this from Zulu, and it works fine.

```
openjdk version "1.8.0_342"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (Zulu 8.64.0.15-CA-macos-aarch64) (build 1.8.0_342-b07)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (Zulu 8.64.0.15-CA-macos-aarch64) (build 25.342-b07, mixed mode)
```

rename.from: Gradle Sync fails when running on aarch64
rename.to: Gradle toolchain cannot automatically download JDK 8 for aarch64 on macOS

body: Leaving this ticket open for the time being, since we should update the README to reflect this.

FWIW There are plans for Gradle to support using the [foojay Disco API](https://github.com/foojayio/discoapi) instead of the one from Adoptium which will allow provisioning aarch64-compatible JDKs automatically.

issue.title: Document need to install JDK 8 on Silicon Macs
